Comment:
This is a short cheeky game in which I blundered but managed to catch out my opponent with a checkmate while still in the opening stage of the game.

I was relying on my opponent wanting to exchange pieces after I lost a piece, and also offered up a somewhat innocent looking exchange.

Enjoy!
Attacking pawn, very standard
Attacking pawn, very standard
Attacking pawn, very standard
Defending...
Attacking...
Didn't expect this, it kind of threw me a bit and I lost my flow...
Didn't expect this, it kind of threw me a bit and I lost my flow...
Didn't expect this, it kind of threw me a bit and I lost my flow...
So I threw my knight away!!
As expected! Now I really need to think carefully...
Lets get the king safe first!
Attackung the knight
Attackung the knight

Knight moves to safety and protects bishop.

I assume white will want to exchange wherever possible....everything else being neutral of course.

it is my job now to take great care of my pieces!!  But I do have an idea...
Maybe not the best move, but I am relying on white wanting to exchange bishops.
So I take with the pawn, naturally!
So I take with the pawn, naturally!
Being in the early stage of the game my gamble pays off...

Checkmate!

What I learned from this is whatever the stage of the game it is always important to consider the threats and defences of both sides.

I got caught out by some unusual pawn moves but I got my revenge by moving the queen out early and offering up an exchange.
